instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
only greenlight  PPBUS_G3H 12.25v using 85w fake charger.
j6950 scl/sda 3.4v
u7000 pin 17-18 3.5ohms 27-28 21.1ohms
1. 0v
2. 16.2v
3. 3.9v
9. 0v
12. 3.4v
13. 3.4v
14. 3.3v
15. 0v
17. 12.25v
19. 5v
20. 5v
25. 16.5v
27.  16.1v
previously replaced q7035 cause chrg_phase is shorted also replaced u7100

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
Do you get green light on Magsafe with original charger?
If not, replace Q7080.

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
i got green light on orig 60w charger 
tried replace q7080 still same.

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
Post voltage and diode mode for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Check w/ and w/o BIL connected (J6955).
If no good, remove D6950 and test again.

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
SCL 0.521ohms 3.4v stable
SDA 0.502ohms 0v-3.4v looping with/without D6950

w/ and w/o BIL nothing changes

threads.title: 820-2915 not charging
threads.message:
You should get less than 1% difference between both lines; in diode mode.
Remove C6952/53 and test again.
If still the same, change U7000.
SMC is the last option.

BTW, battery should be removed...
